#!/bin/bash

# Set the port to 9999
export A2A_PORT=9999

# Navigate to the directory
cd "$(dirname "$0")"

# Start the server
echo "Starting Helloworld A2A Server on port 9999..."
node a2a-server.js

content.content:
1→#!/bin/bash
     2→# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
     3→# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory
     4→
     5→echo "🚀 Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
     6→echo "===================================="
     7→
     8→# Colors for output
     9→GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    10→YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    11→RED='\033[0;31m'
    12→BLUE='\033[0;34m'
    13→NC='\033[0m' # No Color
    14→
    15→# Get script directory
    16→SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
    17→cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"
    18→
    19→# Set log and pid directory
    20→LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/log e pid"
    21→mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"
    22→
    23→# Set port
    24→PORT=9999
    25→NAME="HelloWorld"
    26→PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
    27→LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"
    28→
    29→# Check if already running
    30→if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    31→    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    32→    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    33→        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
    34→        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
    35→        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    36→        exit 0
    37→    else
    38→        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Removing stale PID file${NC}"
    39→        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    40→    fi
    41→fi
    42→
    43→# Check if port is available
    44→if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    45→    echo -e "${RED}❌ Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    46→    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    47→    exit 1
    48→fi
    49→
    50→echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is available${NC}"
    51→
    52→# Activate virtual environment if exists
    53→if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    54→    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    55→    source .venv/bin/activate
    56→elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    57→    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    58→    source ../.venv/bin/activate
    59→fi
    60→
    61→# Start the server
    62→echo -e "${BLUE}🤖 Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"
    63→
    64→# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
    65→if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    66→    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using uv to run server${NC}"
    67→    nohup uv run python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
    68→else
    69→    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using python directly${NC}"
    70→    nohup python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
    71→fi
    72→
    73→PID=$!
    74→echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"
    75→
    76→# Wait for server to start
    77→echo -e "${YELLOW}⏳ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
    78→sleep 3
    79→
    80→# Verify server started
    81→if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    82→    # Test discovery endpoint
    83→    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    84→        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
    85→        echo ""
    86→        echo -e "${BLUE}📊 Agent Details:${NC}"
    87→        echo -e "   • Name: HelloWorld Agent"
    88→        echo -e "   • Port: $PORT"
    89→        echo -e "   • PID: $PID"
    90→        echo -e "   • URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
    91→        echo ""
    92→        echo -e "${BLUE}🔗 Endpoints:${NC}"
    93→        echo -e "   • Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
    94→        echo -e "   • API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
    95→        echo ""
    96→        echo -e "${BLUE}📋 Management:${NC}"
    97→        echo -e "   • View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
    98→        echo -e "   • Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
    99→        echo -e "   • Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
   100→        echo ""
   101→        echo -e "${GREEN}🎯 HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
   102→    else
   103→        echo -e "${RED}❌ Server started but not responding${NC}"
   104→        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
   105→        exit 1
   106→    fi
   107→else
   108→    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
   109→    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
   110→    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
   111→    exit 1
   112→fi

file.content:
#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "🚀 Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/log e pid"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}🤖 Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}⏳ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📊 Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   • Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   • PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   • URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}🔗 Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   • API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📋 Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   • Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   • Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}🎯 HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}❌ Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

file.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Script to run Helloworld A2A Server on port 9999

# Kill any existing process on port 9999
echo "🔍 Checking for existing processes on port 9999..."
lsof -ti:9999 | xargs kill -9 2>/dev/null || true

# Wait a moment
sleep 1

# Set port
export A2A_PORT=9999

# Navigate to script directory
cd "$(dirname "$0")"

# Create log file
LOG_FILE="helloworld-9999.log"

# Start server in background
echo "🚀 Starting Helloworld A2A Server on port 9999..."
nohup node server-stable.js > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &

# Get PID
PID=$!
echo $PID > helloworld-9999.pid

# Wait for server to start
sleep 2

# Check if server is running
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null; then
    echo "✅ Server started successfully!"
    echo "📍 Server running at: http://localhost:9999"
    echo "📄 PID: $PID (saved to helloworld-9999.pid)"
    echo "📋 Logs: tail -f $LOG_FILE"
    echo ""
    echo "To stop the server: kill $PID"
    echo "Or use: kill \$(cat helloworld-9999.pid)"
else
    echo "❌ Failed to start server. Check $LOG_FILE for errors."
    exit 1
fi

Está **perfeito na pasta `json/`**! 

**Motivos:**
1. **Organização** - Separa configuração do código principal
2. **Padrão comum** - Muitos projetos usam `/config`, `/json`, `/data` 
3. **Escalabilidade** - Se crescer, já tem estrutura organizada
4. **Clareza** - Fica claro que são arquivos de configuração

**Estrutura atual é ideal:**
- Raiz: arquivos principais (`server.py`, `server-stable.js`)
- `json/`: configurações 
- `script/`: utilitários
- `agents/`: lógica de negócio

**Mantenha assim!** ✅

Se precisar referenciar os JSONs no código, apenas ajuste o caminho:
```python
# server.py
config = load_json("json/a2a-config.json")
```

A organização está profissional e sustentável.

content.text:
Sim! Algumas sugestões para melhorar ainda mais:

**📁 Pastas que fariam sentido:**

1. **`docs/`** - Para README.md e documentação
   - `README.md` → `docs/README.md`

2. **`config/`** - Renomear `json/` para ser mais genérico
   - `json/` → `config/`
   - Pode incluir futuros `.yaml`, `.env`, etc.

3. **`data/`** - Para arquivos de dados/cache
   - `agent_cards/` → `data/agent_cards/`
   - `log e pid/` → `data/logs/` (renomear sem espaços)

4. **`src/`** - Para código principal
   - `server.py`, `server-stable.js` → `src/`
   - `agent.py`, `agent_executor.py` → `src/`

**🎯 Estrutura sugerida:**
```
helloworld/
├── src/           # Código principal
├── config/        # Configurações
├── script/        # Scripts utilitários  
├── data/          # Dados, logs, cards
├── docs/          # Documentação
└── agents/        # Lógica de agentes
```

**Qual dessas faria mais sentido para você?**

## Visão Geral do A2A Protocol

**A2A (Agent2Agent) Protocol** - Protocolo aberto do Google para comunicação segura entre agentes de IA

### Características Principais:
- **Simples**: HTTP, JSON-RPC, SSE
- **Pronto para empresa**: Seguro e confiável
- **Async-first**: Suporte nativo a operações assíncronas
- **Agnóstico à modalidade**: Funciona com diferentes tipos de dados
- **"Execução Opaca: Agentes interagem sem compartilhar lógica interna"**

## Recursos Oficiais

- **Website**: google.github.io/A2A
- **GitHub**: github.com/google/A2A

## Implementações da Comunidade

### 1. Bibliotecas por Linguagem

#### TypeScript
- **"legion-a2a"**: Implementação modular

#### Go
- **"a2a-go"**: Biblioteca de servidor

#### Rust
- **"a2a-rs"**: Arquitetura hexagonal

#### Python
- **"python-a2a"**, **"a2a_min"**: Múltiplas implementações

#### .NET
- **"a2adotnet"**: Implementação para ecossistema Microsoft

### 2. Integrações com Frameworks

#### Python
- **LangGraph**: Framework para grafos de linguagem
- **CrewAI**: Sistema multi-agente
- **Google ADK**: Kit de desenvolvimento de agentes

#### JavaScript/TypeScript
- **Genkit**: Framework do Google para IA generativa

### 3. Projetos da Comunidade

#### Aira
- Implementação de rede A2A
- Hospedagem, registro, descoberta e interação com agentes

#### Cognisphere
- Framework de desenvolvimento de agentes IA
- Construído sobre Google's ADK

## Primeiros Passos

### Passos Recomendados:
1. **Ler documentação técnica**
2. **Assistir vídeo de demonstração**
3. **Clonar repositório oficial**
4. **Explorar implementações de exemplo**

## Aplicação

Recomendado para desenvolvedores interessados em **sistemas de agentes IA interoperáveis**, permitindo criar ecossistemas de agentes que podem se comunicar e colaborar independentemente de suas implementações internas.

## Filosofia do Protocolo

O A2A Protocol promove a criação de um **ecossistema de agentes interoperáveis**, onde diferentes agentes especializados podem colaborar para resolver problemas complexos, similar a como diferentes serviços web colaboram na internet.

```
helloworld/
├── docs/                 # Documentação (padrão A2A)
│   └── README.md
├── specification/        # Especificação do agente
│   ├── agent_card.json

│   ├── server.py
│   ├── server-stable.js
│   ├── agent.py
│   └── agent_executor.py
├── agents/               # Lógica dos agentes
├── scripts/              # Scripts utilitários
└── logs/                 # Logs (sem espaços no nome)
```

**🔄 Mudanças sugeridas:**
1. `json/` → `specification/` (mais A2A-like)
2. `script/` → `scripts/` (plural, padrão)
3. `log e pid/` → `logs/` (sem espaços)
4. Criar `docs/` para documentação
5. Criar `src/` para código principal

input.content:
# HelloWorld A2A Agent

Um agente A2A (Agent-to-Agent) de exemplo para demonstração e teste do protocolo A2A Protocol.

## 📋 Visão Geral

Este projeto implementa um agente HelloWorld seguindo o **A2A Protocol** do Google, demonstrando comunicação básica entre agentes de IA. O agente responde a mensagens com saudações personalizadas e serve como base para desenvolvimento de agentes mais complexos.

## 🏗️ Arquitetura A2A

Baseado nos **componentes principais do A2A Protocol**:

1. **Agent Registry**: Registro e descoberta de agentes
2. **Communication Layer**: Comunicação HTTP/WebSocket 
3. **Capability Description**: Descrição padronizada de habilidades
4. **Security Layer**: Autenticação e criptografia
5. **Negotiation Protocol**: Negociação de colaboração

## 📁 Estrutura do Projeto

```
helloworld/
├── docs/                    # Documentação
│   └── README.md
├── specification/           # Configurações A2A
│   ├── agent_card.json     # Card do agente
│   └── a2a-config.json     # Configuração A2A
├── src/                     # Código principal
│   ├── server.py           # Servidor Python (porta 9999)
│   ├── server-stable.js    # Servidor Node.js (porta 9999)
│   ├── agent.py            # Lógica do agente Python
│   └── agent_executor.py   # Executor de tarefas
├── agents/                  # Agentes JavaScript
│   ├── helloworld_agent.js # Implementação do agente
│   └── index.js            # Índice dos agentes
├── scripts/                 # Scripts utilitários
│   ├── start_helloworld.sh # Iniciar agente Python
│   └── stop_helloworld.sh  # Parar agente Python
├── logs/                    # Logs e PIDs
└── agent_cards/            # Cards adicionais
```

## 🚀 Como Usar

### Python Server (Porta 9999)
```bash
./scripts/start_helloworld.sh
```

### Node.js Server (Porta 9999)
```bash
node src/server-stable.js
```

## 🔗 Endpoints A2A

- **Discovery**: `/.well-known/agent.json`
- **API Docs**: `/docs` 
- **Health**: `/health`
- **Messages**: `/messages`

## 🎯 Características

- ✅ **Offline-First**: Funciona sem conexão
- ✅ **Async-first**: Suporte nativo a operações assíncronas
- ✅ **Agnóstico à modalidade**: Funciona com diferentes tipos de dados
- ✅ **Execução Opaca**: Agentes interagem sem compartilhar lógica interna
- ✅ **Pronto para empresa**: Seguro e confiável

## 📚 Recursos A2A

- **Website Oficial**: [a2aprotocol.ai](https://a2aprotocol.ai)
- **GitHub**: [github.com/google/A2A](https://github.com/google/A2A)
- **Documentação**: [a2aprotocol.ai/docs](https://a2aprotocol.ai/docs/)

## 🛠️ Tecnologias

- **Python**: FastAPI, Uvicorn, Pydantic
- **Node.js**: Express, CORS, Body-parser
- **Protocolos**: HTTP, JSON-RPC, SSE
- **Padrões**: A2A Protocol, OpenAPI

## 📝 Logs

Os logs são salvos em:
- Python: `logs/HelloWorld.log`
- Node.js: `helloworld-9999.log`

## 🔄 Status

- **Backend**: ✅ Online
- **Frontend**: ✅ Online  
- **Banco Local**: ✅ Ativo
- **A2A Registry**: ✅ Ativo

---

*Implementação de referência do A2A Protocol para aprendizado e demonstração*

# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "🚀 Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/log e pid"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}🤖 Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}⏳ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📊 Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   • Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   • PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   • URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}🔗 Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   • API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📋 Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   • Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   • Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}🎯 HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}❌ Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

[project]
name = "helloworld"
version = "0.2.0"
description = "HelloWorld agent completo - migração de hello_world + funcionalidades avançadas"
readme = "README.md"
requires-python = ">=3.10"
dependencies = [
    "a2a-sdk[sqlite]>=0.2.6",
    "click>=8.1.8",
    "dotenv>=0.9.9",
    "httpx>=0.28.1",
    "langchain-google-genai>=2.1.4",
    "langgraph>=0.4.1",
    "pydantic>=2.11.4",
    "python-dotenv>=1.1.0",
    "uvicorn>=0.34.2",
    # Dependências adicionais para funcionalidades avançadas
    "numpy>=1.24.0",
    "pandas>=2.0.0",
    "sqlalchemy>=2.0.0"
]

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "pytest>=7.0.0",
    "black>=23.0.0", 
    "flake8>=6.0.0",
    "mypy>=1.0.0"
]

[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]
packages = ["."]

[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"

[tool.black]
line-length = 88
target-version = ['py310']

[tool.mypy]
python_version = "3.10"
warn_return_any = true
warn_unused_configs = true

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Shutdown Script

echo "🛑 Stopping HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR"

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/log e pid"
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"
PORT=9999

echo -e "${BLUE}🔍 Looking for HelloWorld Agent...${NC}"

# Try to stop using PID file
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Found HelloWorld Agent (PID: $PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Sending SIGTERM...${NC}"
        kill $PID
        
        # Wait for graceful shutdown
        for i in {1..5}; do
            if ! ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent stopped gracefully${NC}"
                rm -f "$PID_FILE"
                break
            fi
            sleep 1
        done
        
        # Force kill if still running
        if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  Process still running, forcing shutdown...${NC}"
            kill -9 $PID
            sleep 1
            if ! ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent stopped (forced)${NC}"
            else
                echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to stop HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
            fi
        fi
        rm -f "$PID_FILE" 2>/dev/null
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  PID file exists but process not running${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Cleaning up stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  No PID file found${NC}"
fi

# Check if port is still in use
echo -e "${BLUE}🔍 Checking port $PORT...${NC}"
if lsof -ti:$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    PID=$(lsof -ti:$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN)
    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  Found process on port $PORT (PID: $PID)${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Killing process...${NC}"
    kill $PID 2>/dev/null
    sleep 1
    if ! lsof -ti:$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is now free${NC}"
    else
        kill -9 $PID 2>/dev/null
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT freed (forced)${NC}"
    fi
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is already free${NC}"
fi

# Clean up any stray python processes running server.py in this directory
echo -e "${BLUE}🔍 Looking for stray server.py processes...${NC}"
STRAY_PIDS=$(pgrep -f "python.*$SCRIPT_DIR/server.py")
if [ ! -z "$STRAY_PIDS" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Found stray processes: $STRAY_PIDS${NC}"
    kill $STRAY_PIDS 2>/dev/null
    sleep 1
    echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Stray processes cleaned${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}✅ No stray processes found${NC}"
fi

# Cleanup options
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}🧹 Cleanup Options${NC}"
echo "==================="
read -p "Do you want to clean up log files? (y/N): " -n 1 -r
echo
if [[ $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
    if [ -f "$LOG_FILE" ]; then
        # Create backup
        mv "$LOG_FILE" "$LOG_FILE.backup" 2>/dev/null
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Log file backed up to $LOG_FILE.backup${NC}"
    fi
else
    echo -e "${BLUE}📝 Log files preserved${NC}"
fi

# Summary
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}🎯 Shutdown Summary${NC}"
echo "==================="
echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent stopped${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is free${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}✅ PID file cleaned${NC}"

echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}💡 Next Steps:${NC}"
echo "   • Start agent again: ./start_helloworld.sh"
echo "   • View old logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE.backup\" (if backed up)"
echo "   • Check port status: lsof -i:$PORT"

echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}🛑 HelloWorld shutdown complete!${NC}"

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "🚀 Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}🤖 Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}⏳ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📊 Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   • Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   • PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   • URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}🔗 Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   • API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📋 Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   • Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   • Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}🎯 HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}❌ Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Node.js Server Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999

echo "🚀 Starting HelloWorld A2A Node.js Server..."
echo "============================================"

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory and navigate to project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorldJS"
PID_FILE="logs/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="logs/${NAME}.log"

# Create logs directory
mkdir -p logs

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  HelloWorld Node.js Server is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Check if node_modules exists
if [ ! -d "node_modules" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📦 Installing Node.js dependencies...${NC}"
    npm install
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}🤖 Starting HelloWorld Node.js Server on port $PORT...${NC}"
nohup node src/server-stable.js > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}⏳ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test server endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Node.js Server started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📊 Server Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Name: HelloWorld Node.js Server"
        echo -e "   • Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   • PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   • URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}🔗 Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   • Health: http://localhost:$PORT/health"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📋 Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   • Stop server: ./scripts/stop_nodejs.sh"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}🎯 HelloWorld Node.js Server is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}❌ Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to start HelloWorld Node.js Server${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Node.js Server Shutdown Script

echo "🛑 Stopping HelloWorld A2A Node.js Server..."
echo "============================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory and navigate to project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set variables
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorldJS"
PID_FILE="logs/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="logs/${NAME}.log"

echo -e "${BLUE}🔍 Looking for HelloWorld Node.js Server...${NC}"

# Check PID file
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Found HelloWorld Node.js Server (PID: $PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}🔫 Stopping process...${NC}"
        
        # Try graceful shutdown first
        kill $PID 2>/dev/null
        sleep 2
        
        # Force kill if still running
        if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}💀 Force killing process...${NC}"
            kill -9 $PID 2>/dev/null
        fi
        
        # Remove PID file
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Node.js Server stopped${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  PID file exists but process not running${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  No PID file found${NC}"
fi

# Check port
echo -e "${BLUE}🔍 Checking port $PORT...${NC}"
PORT_PID=$(lsof -ti:$PORT 2>/dev/null)
if [ -n "$PORT_PID" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}🔫 Killing process on port $PORT (PID: $PORT_PID)...${NC}"
    kill -9 $PORT_PID 2>/dev/null
    echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is now free${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is already free${NC}"
fi

# Auto-cleanup logs (no confirmation)
REPLY="y"
if [[ $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
    if [ -f "$LOG_FILE" ]; then
        # Create backup
        mv "$LOG_FILE" "$LOG_FILE.backup" 2>/dev/null
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Log file backed up to $LOG_FILE.backup${NC}"
    fi
fi

echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}🎯 Shutdown Summary${NC}"
echo "==================="
echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Node.js Server stopped${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is free${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}✅ PID file cleaned${NC}"

echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}💡 Next Steps:${NC}"
echo "   • Start server again: ./scripts/start_nodejs.sh"
echo "   • View old logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE.backup\" (if backed up)"
echo "   • Check port status: lsof -i:$PORT"

echo ""
echo -e "${GREEN}🛑 HelloWorld Node.js shutdown complete!${NC}"

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "🚀 Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}🤖 Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use python directly (skip uv due to build issues)
echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using python directly${NC}"
nohup python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}⏳ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📊 Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   • Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   • PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   • URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}🔗 Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   • API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📋 Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   • Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   • Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}🎯 HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}❌ Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

# Starts HelloWorld agent using A2A Protocol standard

echo "🚀 Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory and navigate to project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port (A2A default is dynamic, check server.py for actual port)
PORT=9999  # Actual port used by A2A server
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script
# Starts HelloWorld agent on port 9999 using log e pid directory

echo "🚀 Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port
PORT=9999
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}🤖 Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv (A2A standard) - build issues fixed
echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using uv to run server (A2A standard)${NC}"
nohup uv run python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}⏳ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📊 Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   • Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   • PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   • URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}🔗 Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   • API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📋 Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   • Stop agent: ./stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   • Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}🎯 HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}❌ Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

#!/bin/bash
# HelloWorld A2A Agent Startup Script  
# Starts HelloWorld agent using A2A Protocol standard

echo "🚀 Starting HelloWorld A2A Agent..."
echo "===================================="

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Get script directory and navigate to project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )"
cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.."

# Set log and pid directory
LOG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/../logs"
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# Set port (A2A default is dynamic, check server.py for actual port)
PORT=9999  # Actual port used by A2A server
NAME="HelloWorld"
PID_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.pid"
LOG_FILE="$LOG_DIR/${NAME}.log"

# Check if already running
if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]; then
    OLD_PID=$(cat "$PID_FILE")
    if ps -p $OLD_PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}⚠️  HelloWorld Agent is already running (PID: $OLD_PID)${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Port: $PORT${NC}"
        echo -e "${BLUE}   Logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 0
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Removing stale PID file${NC}"
        rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    fi
fi

# Check if port is available
if lsof -Pi :$PORT -sTCP:LISTEN -t >/dev/null ; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Port $PORT is already in use${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Try: lsof -i:$PORT${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

echo -e "${GREEN}✅ Port $PORT is available${NC}"

# Activate virtual environment if exists
if [ -d ".venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating virtual environment${NC}"
    source .venv/bin/activate
elif [ -d "../.venv" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}📦 Activating parent virtual environment${NC}"
    source ../.venv/bin/activate
fi

# Start the server
echo -e "${BLUE}🤖 Starting HelloWorld Agent on port $PORT...${NC}"

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
if command -v uv &> /dev/null && [ -f "pyproject.toml" ]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using uv to run server${NC}"
    nohup uv run python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using python directly${NC}"
    nohup python src/server.py > "$LOG_FILE" 2>&1 &
fi

PID=$!
echo $PID > "$PID_FILE"

# Wait for server to start
echo -e "${YELLOW}⏳ Waiting for server to start...${NC}"
sleep 3

# Verify server started
if ps -p $PID > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    # Test discovery endpoint
    if curl -s --max-time 2 "http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}✅ HelloWorld Agent started successfully!${NC}"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📊 Agent Details:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Name: HelloWorld Agent"
        echo -e "   • Port: $PORT"
        echo -e "   • PID: $PID"
        echo -e "   • URL: http://localhost:$PORT"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}🔗 Endpoints:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • Discovery: http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo -e "   • API Docs: http://localhost:$PORT/docs"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${BLUE}📋 Management:${NC}"
        echo -e "   • View logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\""
        echo -e "   • Stop agent: ./scripts/stop_helloworld.sh"
        echo -e "   • Check status: curl http://localhost:$PORT/.well-known/agent.json"
        echo ""
        echo -e "${GREEN}🎯 HelloWorld Agent is ready!${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}❌ Server started but not responding${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: tail -f \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
else
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to start HelloWorld Agent${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}   Check logs: cat \"$LOG_FILE\"${NC}"
    rm -f "$PID_FILE"
    exit 1
fi

# Use uv if available, otherwise use python directly
echo -e "${YELLOW}📝 Using uv to run server${NC}"
